title: Trader shot dead in Dhaka's Shyambazar: Rab arrests prime suspect
body: Rapid Action Battalion (Rab) has arrested the prime suspect in connection with the shooting of a businessman in Old Dhaka's Shyambazar area yesterday. A Rab team arrested Nayan from Mirpur last night and seized a firearm from his possession, Tapos Karmakar, media officer of Rab-10, told The Daily Star. He added that Rab will hold a press briefing later in the day to provide further details. The victim, Abdur Rahman, 55, a spice trader and former president of the Shyambazar Kachabazar Traders' Association, was shot around noon in front of the Maula Buksh Sarder Eye Hospital in Shyambazar. Critically injured, Rahman was rushed to Sir Salimullah Medical College Mitford Hospital by pedestrians, where doctors pronounced him dead around 1:30pm, said Motiur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Sutrapur Police Station.
